abstracts.cdata!:
The assessment of outcome is
            unsatisfactory, sustainability unlikely, and institutional
            development impacts only modest. Lessons are outlined as
            follows. While the project was limited in its scope to
            rehabilitation, and institutional building within the State
            Water Agency (SWA), thus limited in its impact, the Bank
            rightly used the project to initiate, and promote policy
            reforms. To this end, the sector was well positioned on the
            national agenda - once political stabilization was achieved
            - and, it is important to note that this could not have been
            achieved, had it not been for the interest emerged,
            championed within the country, for initiating, and
            implementing reforms. However, it also holds true that in a
            country where logistics are often difficult, projects should
            be kept focused only on few states: management
            infrastructure was weak to supervise the large number of
            subprojects, which led to delays; rather a focus on full
            rehabilitation would have been preferred, which could have
            raised awareness, and capacity building within all SWAs.
            This obviously led to a large number of small contracts,
            which could not attract international contractors, but
            instead overstreched national capacity. In designing water
            supply works, perspectives should lie on getting water to
            the ultimate beneficiary: benefits however were constrained
            by inadequate distribution networks, a factor which could
            have been solved by the SWAs financing additional works
            themselves, provided political stability existed. Other
            lessons reinforce project preparation be well advanced prior
            to loan effectiveness; funds should be secured; Project
            Preparation Facility mechanisms be used as needed; and,
            reliable performance indicators facilitate the monitoring process.
